agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Judiciary & Civil Jurisprudence TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 23, 2019 PLACE: JHR 120 CHAIR: Rep. Jeff Leach Public testimony will be limited to three (3) minutes. The order in which bills are heard will be at the discretion of the chair. HB 3918 Dutton Relating to suits against certain governmental employees. HB 4551 Dutton Relating to the award of court costs and attorney's fees in certain actions challenging certain local laws or the failure of an officer of certain political subdivisions to perform certain actions. HB 3568 Farrar Relating to the salary paid to an official court reporter in certain counties. HB 1975 Vo Relating to repeal of the waiver of the right to judicial review of a wage claim. HB 4716 Button Relating to the municipal court of record of the City of Rowlett. HB 1383 Lozano Relating to exemption of certain firefighters and police officers from jury service. SB 362 Huffman | et al. Relating to court-ordered mental health services. HB 3409 Reynolds | et al. Relating to requirements for training regarding trauma for judges, prosecuting attorneys, correctional officers, and law enforcement officers. HB 3627 Reynolds Relating to qualifications of licensed court interpreters. HB 2470 Thompson, Ed Relating to an action for the damage to property value caused by the use of an easement. HB 4361 Thompson, Ed Relating to the standing of municipalities in certain civil actions. HB 1637 Miller Relating to required training regarding trauma-informed care for certain judges and attorneys. SB 467 Zaffirini Relating to the procedures of the State Commission on Judicial Conduct. HB 1334 Clardy Relating to the terms of court for the 4th District Court. HB 3575 Klick Relating to the provision of notice of proposed rules by state agencies. SB 192 Perry Relating to the transfer of certain probate proceedings to the county in which the executor or administrator of a decedent's estate resides. HB 2437 Murr Relating to recovery of attorney's fees in certain civil cases. HB 3136 Cain Relating to carrying a weapon on the premises of a government court or offices utilized by the court. SB 27 Hughes | et al. Relating to recovery of damages, attorney's fees, and costs related to frivolous claims and regulatory actions by state agencies. HB 3946 Hefner Relating to immunity from liability of public and private schools and security personnel employed by those schools for certain actions of security personnel. SB 395 Zaffirini Relating to certain notice requirements and filing requirements in court proceedings involving persons with mental illness. HB 2938 Hinojosa Relating to the authority of the commissioners court of a county to employ attorneys as mental health public defenders and to the reimbursement of an attorney who represents an indigent proposed patient in certain mental health proceedings. HB 3021 Ramos Relating to informing the public about the availability of provisions in protective orders regarding pets and other companion animals. HB 3570 Ramos Relating to continuing judicial training regarding family violence victims. HB 2637 Calanni Relating to supreme court orders for conducting court proceedings during a disaster. HB 4021 Dominguez Relating to certain locations at which a person is prohibited from carrying a weapon. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 3918 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
